mortar.api.inventory

Class AnvilGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • mortar.api.inventory.AnvilGUI

  • public class AnvilGUI
extends Object
    An anvil gui, used for gathering a user's input
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wesley Smith

      Deprecated. 
      Since version 1.1, use AnvilGUI(Plugin, Player, String, BiFunction) instead

      Class wrapping the magic constants of slot numbers in an anvil GUI

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnvilGUI

        @Deprecated
public AnvilGUI(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                             org.bukkit.entity.Player holder,
                             String insert,
                             AnvilGUI.ClickHandler clickHandler)
        Deprecated. As of version 1.1, use AnvilGUI(Plugin, Player, String, BiFunction)
        Create an AnvilGUI and open it for the player
        Parameters:
        plugin - A JavaPlugin instance
        holder - The Player to open the inventory for
        insert - What to have the text already set to
        clickHandler - A AnvilGUI.ClickHandler that is called when the player clicks the AnvilGUI.Slot.OUTPUT slot
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the server version isn't supported

      • AnvilGUI

        public AnvilGUI(org.bukkit.plugin.Plugin plugin,
                org.bukkit.entity.Player holder,
                String insert,
                BiFunction<org.bukkit.entity.Player,String,String> biFunction)
        Create an AnvilGUI and open it for the player.
        Parameters:
        plugin - A JavaPlugin instance
        holder - The Player to open the inventory for
        insert - What to have the text already set to
        biFunction - A BiFunction that is called when the player clicks the AnvilGUI.Slot.OUTPUT slot
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - If the server version isn't supported

      • closeInventory

        public void closeInventory()
        Closes the inventory if it's open.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the inventory isn't open
